definitions.definition: a thing made to be similar or identical to another.
examples: the problem is telling which is the original document and which the copy
synonyms: fake; informalknockoff "a copy of a sketch by Leonardo da Vinci"

definitions.definition: a single specimen of a particular book, record, or other publication or issue.
examples: the record has sold more than a million copies
copy for the next issue must be submitted by the beginning of the month

definitions.definition: material for a newspaper or magazine article.
examples: it is an unfortunate truth of today's media that bad news makes good copy
“No more stubble—no more trouble,” trumpeted their ad copy

definitions.definition: make a similar or identical version of; reproduce.
examples: each form had to be copied and sent to a different department
synonyms: replicate; Moredatedmimeograph "each form had to be copied"reproduce
counterfeit "portraits copied from original paintings by Reynolds"

definitions.definition: reproduce (data stored in one location) in another location.
examples: the command will copy a file from one disc to another

definitions.definition: write out information that one has read or heard.
examples: he copied the details into his notebook

definitions.definition: send a copy of a letter to (a third party).
send someone a copy of an e-mail that is addressed to a third party.
examples: I attached the document and copied him in so he'd know it had been sent

definitions.definition: imitate the style or behaviour of.
examples: lifestyles that were copied from Miami and Fifth Avenue
synonyms: steal; informalrip off "their sound was copied by a lot of jazz players"

definitions.definition: hear or understand someone speaking on a radio transmitter.
examples: this is Edwards, do you copy, over
